channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI says spending to rise to $115 billion through 2029: Information
item.description: The company predicted it could spend more than $8 billion this year, roughly $1.5 billion more than an earlier projection, The Information said.

item.title: 99.1% of Air Canada flight attendants vote against wage offer that union and airline agreed on, but flights will continue
item.description: Air Canada restarted operations on Aug. 19 after reaching an agreement with the union for 10,000 flight attendants to end a strike that disrupted the ...

item.title: Trump’s closure of the de minimis tariff loophole sent postal traffic to the U.S. to a ‘near-halt’
item.description: Eighty-eight postal operators have told the UPU that they have suspended some or all postal services to the United States.

item.title: RFK Jr. is a ‘threat to the health and wellbeing of every American,’ nephew Joseph Kennedy III says
item.description: “None of us will be spared the pain he is inflicting,” the former congressman added.

item.title: Mortgage rates plunge to 11-month low on Fed rate cut hopes, and many lenders may quote in the high 5% range
item.description: The average rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage sank 16 basis points on Friday to 6.29%, according to Mortgage Daily News.

item.title: OPEC+ meets this weekend at a precarious time for crude oil. What's at stake.
Why Bessent's essay against the Fed is a bid for 'control' over the central bank
